properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Macedon, Mount Macedon, Woodend
 and surrounding areas.
  • There is a bushfire at Coffeys Rd, Bullengarook that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling from Coffeys Road in a north-easterly direction towards Mulcahy Road..
  • There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are responding to this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • These conditions will continue for a number of days
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 22/12/2024 04:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed

Issue Date: Saturday 21 December 2024, 03:52 pm
Next Update: Sunday 22 December 2024, 04:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35193/moreinfo

This Advice message is being issued for Macedon, Mount Macedon, Woodend
 and surrounding areas.
- There is a bushfire at Coffeys Rd, Bullengarook that is not yet under control.
- The bushfire is travelling from Coffeys Road in a north-easterly direction towards Mulcahy Road..


- There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Cabbage Tree, Dean, Wattle Flat, Chapel Flat, Clarkes Hill, Glen Park, Springmount
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Cabbage Tree, Chapel Flat, Clarkes Hill, Dean, Glen Park, Springmount, Wattle Flat.

  • There is a bushfire at Melbourne Rd, Creswick that is contained.
  • Smoke may still be visible to surrounding communities.  
  • Crews and aircraft will continue to work in the area. 
This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 12.28 pm, Saturday 21 December 2024.
You should stay informed, monitor conditions and stay away from the area.

To help ensure the safety of our emergency personnel do not fly drones over the fire area. 

Slow down to a speed that enables you to stop safely when you see emergency services working beside the road. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 

Road closures
All roads are now open. 
40km per hour speed restrictions are in place for the following roads:
  • Creswick-Dean Road between Melbourne Road and Skilbecks Road
  • Melbourne Road between Creswick-Dean Road and Russells Reservoir.   
Forest Tracks
Internal forest tracks in the fire area remain closed including Bush Inn Road.

Replacement fencing information
  • Farm fencing adjoining state or national parks:
The Victorian Government will pay half of the cost of boundary fencing upgrades, up to $5,000 per kilometre to replace or repair fencing between private land and all national parks and state forests destroyed or damaged by bushfires.

  • Farm fencing destroyed by firefighting activities:
The Government will pay 100% of the restoration costs of fences damaged on private land as a result of machinery used by fire agencies to control bushfires, or fire agency staff cutting through fences to allow access for suppression efforts.

The Department of Energy, Environment and Climate Action (DEECA) will assist assessing your property before works are undertaken or any payments are made. Landholders can call find more information on the Department of Energy Environment and Climate Action website or by calling the Contact Centre Team on 136 186, Monday to Friday, 8:00am to 6:00pm

Water replacement 
Any water from your property used by emergency services will be replaced. Find out more information about how to request replacement water on the Department of Energy Environment and Climate Action website or by calling the Contact Centre Team on 136 186, Monday to Friday, 8:00am to 6:00pm

Your water tank before and after fires
If your tank water has been affected by fires you may need to get a tank clean. 
To find out more about keeping your tank water healthy and safe before and after fires visit the Better Health website. 

Recovery information 
If you are a resident with questions about recovery after this fire contact: community recovery@hepburn.vic.gov.au or call 5348 2306.

Djuwang Baring, Creswick Trails is now open. 

Firefighting vehicles and machinery will be moving around in the area.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 22/12/2024 01:10 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Pioneer Bay, Grantville, Jam Jerrup, Lang Lang, The Gurdies
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Grantville, Jam Jerrup, Lang Lang, Pioneer Bay, The Gurdies.

  • There is a bushfire in The Gurdies area that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire has travelled from The Gurdies Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR) in a northerly and easterly direction towards Gurdies St Helier Road and Stewart Road.
  • Overnight fire activity has decreased but this may change at any time.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • Find information on protecting yourself and your family: www.cfa.vic.gov.au/plan-prepare/before-and-during-a-fire 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Bulldozers, aircraft and firefighters are operating in the area.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 21/12/2024 07:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Emergency Warning
properties.webBody:
This Emergency Warning to Evacuate Immediately is being issued for Bullengarook. 

  • There is a bushfire at Coffeys Rd, Bullengarook that is not yet under control. 
  • This fire is travelling from Coffeys Road in a northerly direction towards Mulchahy Road and Waterloo Flat Road. 
  • Due to fire suppression activity the rate of spread of the fire has slowed. 
  • The fire is now expected to impact the warning area with in the next hour 3 to 4 hours. 
  • This Emergency Warning replaces the Emergency Warning issued at 1.09 pm today Saturday 21 December. 
If you choose to stay, emergency services may not be able to help you.
If you are located in the warning area, north of Bullengarook, it is recommended you evacuate immediately and move to a safer location away from the fire.


What you should do: 
This Emergency Warning is current until 5.30 today Saturday December 21st. Evacuation after this time is considered life threatening.

After 5.30 Saturday 21st December it may be too late to leave. Shelter indoors when the fire arrives - protect yourself from the radiant heat.

Evacuate immediately: 
  • Evacuate immediately with all members of your household. 
  • When you leave, remember to take your pets, mobile phone and charger. 
  • If you are away from home, do not return. 

Travel to a safer location. Options include: 
  • A relief centre is open at Kyneton Racecourse, 44 Campaspe Pl, Kyneton 
  • The home of family or friends away from the warning area. 
  • If you evacuate to a family member or friend's house you should register at the evacuation centre  to help others find you. 

In the car: 
  • If you are travelling, do not enter the area. Make a u-turn and travel to safety. 
  • Slow down and turn on your headlights. Smoke will make it difficult to see. 

If you are unable to leave, you should seek shelter inside: 
  • Protect yourself by wearing long sleeves and trousers, made from pure cotton or wool. Wear leather boots and heavy duty leather gloves. 
  • Close all exterior doors, windows and vents. Turn off cooling systems.
  • Shelter in a room that has a door and or a window to the outside. The building can protect you from radiant heat. It is critical to keep an eye on what is happening with the fire. 

If your home catches on fire: 
  • Move away from the rooms that are on fire, closing doors behind you.
  • As soon as the bushfire has passed the house, or the conditions inside become unbearable, you need to get out and go to an area that has already been burnt. Staying inside a burning building will almost certainly end in death. 
  • It may still be too hot to remain outside, so youâ€™ll need to seek shelter in another structure or last resort option. 
Impacts in your area: 
  • The following roads are closed: Coffeys Road and Waterloo Flat Road..
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority. 

The next update is expected by 21/12/2024 06:10 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Kia Ora, Moyston, Willaura, Willaura North, Bornes Hill
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Bornes Hill, Kia Ora, Moyston, Willaura, Willaura North.


  • This Advice replaces the advice issued at 10:04pm Friday 20/12/2024.
  • There is a bushfire in the Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling from Grampians National Park in a northerly direction and has reached Lake Bellfield and the Major Mitchell Plateau. 
  • Back burning operations will be conducted today and smoke will be visible.   

Relief Centres Now Open: 
  • Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Grampians Community Health, known as the Shack, 22 Patrick Street Stawell.

Community Meetings will be held today, Saturday 21 December:
  • 10:00am at the Ararat Town Hall, 193 Barkly Street, Ararat. 
  • 11:30am at the Stawell Town Hall, 63 Main Street, Stawell. 
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are are responding to this fire.
  • Smoke will visible from nearby communities and roads
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
 
Road Closures:

 Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

 Relief Centre Now Open: 
 Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat

Grampians National Park visitor information and closures: 
The Grampians National Park remains closed. This includes sites in the Major Mitchell Plateau, Serra Range and Victoria Range.

For further details please visit the website: Parks Victoria - Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park 

This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 22/12/2024 11:40 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Emergency Warning
properties.webBody:
This Emergency Warning is being issued for Lake Fyans, Pomonal. 

  • This Emergency Warning replaces the Emergency Warning issued at 9:41am today. 
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap road that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling from Grampians National Park in a northerly direction which has reached Lake Bellfield. 
  • Back burning operations will be conducted today and smoke will be visible. 
Relief Centre Now Open:  
Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat 

Community Meetings today, Saturday 21 December:
  • 10:00am at the Ararat Town Hall, 193 Barkly Street, Ararat. 
  • 11:30am at the Stawell Town Hall, 63 Main Street, Stawell. 
Leaving immediately is the safest option, before conditions become too dangerous. 

Emergency services may not be able to help you if you decide to stay.
What you should do: 

Travel to: 
  • The home of family or friends that is away from the warning area.
  • When you leave remember to take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger.
  • A relief centre is open at Alexandra Oval Community Centre, 1 Waratah Avenue, Ararat. 

In the car: 
  • If you are travelling, do not enter the area. Make a u-turn and travel to safety.
  • Slow down and turn on your headlights. Smoke will make it difficult to see.

If you are unable to leave you should shelter indoors:
  • Close all exterior doors, windows and vents. Turn off cooling systems.
  • You must take shelter before the fire arrives. The extreme heat is likely to kill you well before the flames reach you.
  • Shelter in a room that has two exits, such as a door or window including one directly to the outside. It is important to be able to see outside so you know what is happening with the fire. 
  • If your home catches on fire and the conditions inside become unbearable, you need to get out and go to an area that has already been burnt. 

If you cannot get indoors, other last resort options include:
  • Shelter in the middle of a large open area like a ploughed paddock, football oval or sporting reserve.
  • Get into a large body of water like a dam, lake, river, the ocean or inground pool.
  • Try to protect yourself from the fire's heat.

If you are caught in fire in your car:
  • Park behind a solid structure to block the fire's heat or pull over to cleared area.
  • Try to position the car towards the approaching fire.
  • Turn on your hazard lights and headlights.
  • Close all windows.
  • Turn off the air-conditioning and shut all the air vents.
  • Turn your car engine off.
  • Get down as low as possible below window level and cover up with a pure woollen blanket.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Bushfires can generate extreme heat. Heat will kill you before the fire reaches you. 
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.

Road Closures: 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
Grampians National Park:
Grampians National Park is closed
For further details visit the Parks Victoria Website: Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park
This messages was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 21/12/2024 05:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Emergency Warning
properties.location: Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Flat Rock Crossing, Grampians Junction, Halls Gap, Fyans Creek
properties.webBody:
This Emergency Warning to Evacuate Immediately is being issued for Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Flat Rock Crossing, Fyans Creek, Grampians Junction, Halls Gap.
 
  • This Emergency Warning replaces the Emergency Warning issued at 10:57am. 
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling from Grampians National Park in a northerly direction towards Halls Gap. 
  • The bushfire has reached Lake Bellfield. 
Relief centers are open in:

  • Ararat - Alexandra Oval Community Centre, 1 Waratah Avenue, Ararat. 
  • Stawell - Grampians Community Health "The Shacc"  22 Patrick Street, Stawell

Recordings of Community meeting are available from the VicEmergency-Grampians Facebook


If you choose to stay, emergency services may not be able to help you.
If you are located in Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Flat Rock Crossing, Fyans Creek, Grampians Junction, Halls Gap, it is recommended you evacuate immediately and move to a safer location away from the fire.
What you should do: 
This Emergency Warning is current until 6:00 pm. Evacuation after this time is considered life threatening.

Evacuate immediately: 
  • Evacuate immediately with all members of your household. 
  • When you leave, remember to take your pets, mobile phone and charger. 
  • If you are away from home, do not return. 

Travel to a safer location. Options include: 
  • Relief centers are open at:
 Ararat - Alexandra Oval Community Centre, 1 Waratah Avenue, Ararat.
 Stawell - Grampians Community Health, "The Shacc"  22 Patrick Street, Stawell.

  • The home of family or friends away from the warning area. 
  • If you evacuate to a family member or friend's house you should register with at an evacuation centre to help others find you. 

Residents in Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Flat Rock Crossing, Fyans Creek, Grampians Junction, Halls Gap should leave via Grampians Road and head towards Stawell. 

In the car: 
  • If you are travelling, do not enter the area. Make a u-turn and travel to safety. 
  • Slow down and turn on your headlights. Smoke will make it difficult to see. 

If you are unable to leave, you should seek shelter inside: 
  • Protect yourself by wearing long sleeves and trousers, made from pure cotton or wool. Wear leather boots and heavy duty leather gloves. 
  • Close all exterior doors, windows and vents. Turn off cooling systems.
  • Shelter in a room that has a door and or a window to the outside. The building can protect you from radiant heat. It is critical to keep an eye on what is happening with the fire. 

If your home catches on fire: 
  • Move away from the rooms that are on fire, closing doors behind you.
  • As soon as the bushfire has passed the house, or the conditions inside become unbearable, you need to get out and go to an area that has already been burnt. Staying inside a burning building will almost certainly end in death. 
  • It may still be too hot to remain outside, so youâ€™ll need to seek shelter in another structure or last resort option. 
Impacts in your area: 
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Bushfires can generate extreme heat. Heat will kill you before the fire reaches you.
  • Bushfires can start spot fires and embers can travel large distances ahead of the main fire.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 21/12/2024 06:10 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.text: EMERGENCY WARNING - BUSHFIRE - Evacuate Immediately Incident Location: Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road Issue Date: Saturday 21 December 2024, 01:05 pm Next Update: Saturday 21 December 2024, 06:10 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35190/moreinfo This Emergency Warning to Evacuate Immediately is being issued for Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Flat Rock Crossing, Fyans Creek, Grampians Junction, Halls Gap. - This Emergency Warning replaces the Emergency Warning issued at 10:57am. - There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control. - The bushfire is travelling from Grampians National Park in a northerly direction towards Halls Gap. - The bushfire has reached Lake Bellfield. Relief centers are open in: - Ararat - Alexandra Oval Community Centre, 1 Waratah Avenue, Ararat. - Stawell - Grampians Community Health "The Shacc" 22 Patrick Street, Stawell Recordings of Community meeting are available from the VicEmergency-Grampians Facebook If you choose to stay, emergency services may not be able to help you. If you are located in Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Flat Rock Crossing, Fyans Creek, Grampians Junction, Halls Gap, it is recommended you evacuate immediately and move to a safer location away from the fire.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Jimmy Creek, Mirranatwa, Bornes Hill, Grampians, Victoria Valley
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Bornes Hill, Grampians, Jimmy Creek, Mirranatwa, Victoria Valley. 

  • This Watch and Act message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 9:59pm Friday 20/12/2024.
  • It is strongly recommended you Prepare to Leave. 
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road. The bushfire is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling from Grampians National Park in a northerly direction and has reached Lake Bellfield and the Major Mitchell Plateau. 
  • Back burning operations will be conducted today and smoke will be visible.   
Relief Centres Now Open: 
  • Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Grampians Community Health, known as the Shack, 22 Patrick Street Stawell.

Community Meetings held today, Saturday 21 December:
  • 10:00am at the Ararat Town Hall, 193 Barkly Street, Ararat. 
  • 11:30am at the Stawell Town Hall, 63 Main Street, Stawell. 
Prepare to Leave. 
What you should do:
  • Monitor the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can mean the situation is worsening.
  • Protect yourself and your family.
  • If you are not prepared, leave now. Donâ€™t wait until it is too late - leave early. 
  • If you are away from home, do not return.
If you are leaving, pack: 
  • Cash 
  • Clothing for three days 
  • Medicine for three days 
  • Phone and chargers 
  • Toiletries 
  • Important documents 
  • Meaningful items and photos 
  • Pet essentials, including leash and carriers.
Check on your neighbours if it is safe.

Check the VicTraffic website for road closures.

Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 

Where to go:
  • Friends or family away from the fire. 
  • Consider roads may become busy closer to the time of impact. 
Impacts in your area: 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 22/12/2024 11:50 am or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Barton, Jallukur and Londonderry. 

  • This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act issued at 6.29pm. 
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap road that is not yet under control.  
  • The bushfire is travelling from Grampians National Park in a northerly direction which has reached Lake Bellfield and the Major Mitchell Plateau. 
  • Back burning operations will be conducted today and smoke will be visible
  • Crews and aircraft continue to work in the area. 
Relief center's are open in:
  • Ararat - Alexandra Oval Community Centre, 1 Waratah Avenue, Ararat. 
  • Stawell - Grampians Community Health "The Shacc"  22 Patrick Street, Stawell

Community Meetings today, Saturday 21 December:
  • 10:00am at the Ararat Town Hall, 193 Barkly Street, Ararat. 
  • 11:30am at the Stawell Town Hall, 63 Main Street, Stawell. 

The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area or Ararat. 
Impacts in your area:
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Bushfires can start spot fires and embers can travel large distances ahead of the main fire.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 21/12/2024 10:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Coffeys Rd, Bullengarook.

  • There is a bushfire at Coffeys Rd, Bullengarook that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling from Coffeys Road in a north-easterly direction towards Mulcahy Road.
  • The wind speed in the fire area has dropped and the spread of the fire has slowed.
  • This Watch & Act replaces the Wat & Act issued at 10.55am today Saturday December 21st
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Impacts in your area:

Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous. 

Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 21/12/2024 07:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Emergency Warning
properties.webBody:
This Emergency Warning is being issued for Mafeking, Watgania. 
  • This Emergency Warning replaces the Emergency Warning issued at 9.02pm Friday. 
  • There is a bushfire in the Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling from Grampians National Park in a northerly direction and has reached Lake Bellfield and the Major Mitchell Plateau. 
  • Back burning operations will be conducted today and smoke will be visible.   
Relief Centre Now Open:  Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat 

Community Meetings will be held today, Saturday 21 December:
  • 10:00am at the Ararat Town Hall, 193 Barkly Street, Ararat. 
  • 11:30am at the Stawell Town Hall, 63 Main Street, Stawell. 

Leaving immediately is the safest option, before conditions become too dangerous. 

Emergency services may not be able to help you if you decide to stay.
What you should do: 

Travel to: 
  • The home of family or friends that is away from the warning area.
  • When you leave remember to take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger.

In the car: 
  • If you are travelling, do not enter the area. Make a u-turn and travel to safety.
  • Slow down and turn on your headlights. Smoke will make it difficult to see.

If you are unable to leave you should shelter indoors:
  • Close all exterior doors, windows and vents. Turn off cooling systems.
  • You must take shelter before the fire arrives. The extreme heat is likely to kill you well before the flames reach you.
  • Shelter in a room that has two exits, such as a door or window including one directly to the outside. It is important to be able to see outside so you know what is happening with the fire. 
  • If your home catches on fire and the conditions inside become unbearable, you need to get out and go to an area that has already been burnt. 

If you cannot get indoors, other last resort options include:
  • Shelter in the middle of a large open area like a ploughed paddock, football oval or sporting reserve.
  • Get into a large body of water like a dam, lake, river, the ocean or inground pool.
  • Try to protect yourself from the fire's heat.

If you are caught in fire in your car:
  • Park behind a solid structure to block the fire's heat or pull over to cleared area.
  • Try to position the car towards the approaching fire.
  • Turn on your hazard lights and headlights.
  • Close all windows.
  • Turn off the air-conditioning and shut all the air vents.
  • Turn your car engine off.
  • Get down as low as possible below window level and cover up with a pure woollen blanket.
Impacts in your area: 
Many roads in the area are closed. Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This messages was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 21/12/2024 04:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for St Helier and The Gurdies. 

  • There is a bushfire at The Gurdies Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR) that is not yet under control.
  • Firefighters have been able to slow the spread of fire for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
  • Further resources have been deployed to the fire, including heavy plant machinery which is engaged in hazard tree removal and construction of containment lines.
  • Aircraft also being used to extinguish fire in private property to the north of Helier Road.  
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • A relief centre is open at the Wonthaggi Aquatic and Leisure Centre (YMCA), 41 Wentworth Road, Wonthaggi.
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Impacts in your area:
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Trees can fall across roads and cause dangerous driving conditions.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 21/12/2024 05:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Licola, Licola North.

  • There is a bushfire at Glencairn Road, Licola that is contained.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters and aircraft are continuing to manage this fire.
  • The Barkley Bridge Campground is currently closed.
  • There is low-level fire activity within containment lines.
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by FFMVic.

The next update is expected by 21/12/2024 07:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
